dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I told Dottie to lose some weight  but she don't wanna listen! He roars with laughter and slaps Hi heartily on the back. he chuckles sympathetically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...No man, I know what you mean. You  got all kinds a responsibilities  now. You're married, ya got a kid,  looks like your whole life's set  down and where's the excitement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Glen, I guess that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! That's the disease, but there  is a cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure; Doctor Glen is tellin' ya you  can heal thyself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I gotta do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you just gotta broaden your  mind a little bit. I mean say I asked  you, what do you think about Dot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine woman you got there. Glen is eyeing him shrewdly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Now it might not look like it,  but lemme tell you something: She's  a hellcat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what's that got to do with-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't rush me! He stops walking. Hi stops also, looking at Glen, Still  puzzled. Glen lays a companionable hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the thing about Dot is, she thinks-  and she's told me this- He looks around as if to make sure they are not being  overheard. His tone is confidential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she thinks... you're cute. Hi looks suspiciously at Glen's hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah...? Glen nods energetically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm crappin' you negative! And I  could say the same about Ed! Through tightly clenched teeth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talkin' about, Glen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'm I talkin' about?!  I'm talkin'  about sex, boy! What the hell're you  talkin' about?! You know, "L'amour"?!  I'm talkin' me'n Dot are Swingers!  As in "to Swing"! Wife-swappin'!  What they call nowadays Open Marriage! Beaming, he takes his hand off Hi's shoulder and spreads arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talkin' about the Sex Revolution!  I'm talkin' about- THWAK - Hi's fist swings into frame to connect solidly wi Glen's jaw. Glen's feet leave the ground. He flies back and lands in heap.

dialogues.speaker: LOW-ANGLE REVERSE
dialogues.text: Glen in the foreground, groggily rubbing his jaw; Hi  approaching menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your goddamned hands off my  wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit man! He is scrambling to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was only tryin' to help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your goddamned hands off my  wife! With Hi still advancing, Glen starts to run.

dialogues.speaker: GLEN
dialogues.text: With Hi pursuing in the background. Glen is looking back over his shoulder to shout at Hi as runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy! I feel pity for you,  man!  You- CRASH! - Glen runs smack into a tree and drops like a sac of cement.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR NIGHT
dialogues.text: Hi is driving, his jaw rigidly set, his temple throbbing. Nathan Jr. sits in a safety seat between him and Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We finally go out with some decent  people and you break his nose. That  ain't too funny, Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stolidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His kids seemed to think it was funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they're just kids, you're a  grown man with responsibilities.  Whatever possessed you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was provokin' me when I popped  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Hi, he's your foreman, he's just  gonna fire you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect he will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where does that leave me and  Nathan Jr.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a man for a husband. He is pulling into a convenience store parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, that's the only answer. He puts the car in park but leaves it running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nathan needs some Huggies. I'll  be out directly. As he gets out of the car:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mind you stay strapped in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand enters to take a package of panty hose from the  standing rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand enters to take a big carton of disposable diapers  from the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pimply-faced lad with a paper 7-Eleven cap on his head. is looking up from a dirty magazine, reacting in horror t something approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi is approaching the check-out island with a gun in one  hand, the carton of Huggies tucked under the other. The L stocking is pulled over his head to distort his features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be taking these Huggies and  whatever cash you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he presses a silent alarm under the lip of his counter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is reading to Nathan Jr. from a large picture book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Not by the hair of my chinny-chin- chin." Then I'll huff and I'll  puff...' She pauses for a moment, listening. We can barely hear a  distant siren. She resumes absently, but her voice trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...and I'll blow your house in..." We can definitely hear the WHOO-WHOO of the siren now, an it is definitely approaching. Ed hooks an arm around the  seat and looks behind the car, then looks forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indistinctly visible through the semi-reflective glass ar two figures at the check-out island. One is pointing some at the other.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ED
dialogues.text: As the siren is growing louder. Under her breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son-of-a-bitch. She unstraps herself and gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-shot of Hi and the CASHIER, who is stuffing bills int grocery bag. Beyond them we can see Ed, outside, circling the front of the car. Her shout is muffled through the glass:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch! With this Hi notices her. He turns to the Cashier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better hurry it up. I'm in dutch  with the wife. But Ed is already getting into the driver's seat of the c

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ED
dialogues.text: As she slams the car door shut. The siren is quite loud n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son-of-a-bitch. Hang on, pumpkin. The car squeals out of the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad car tops a rise to bounce into view, its siren  wailing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE STORE
dialogues.text: Hi bursts out the door, still wearing the stocking. The c of Huggies is still tucked under one arm. Bellowing hopefully after his departing car:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey! We hear the SMACK-CRACK of a gunshot and glass impact, bu the approaching squad car is still too far down the block have been the source. Hi looks around the parking lot, bewildered. The wailing siren is becoming painfully loud. Hi looks behind him at the plate-glass front of the store where a bullet pock mars the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the glass we see the pimply young Cashier with th paper 7-Eleven cap pop up from behind the counter to sigh down his huge .44 Magnum for another shot. The gun is so he uses both hands to heft it. SMACK-CRACK - the bullet kisses another hole in the glass Hi is off and running. The squad car is screeching into the lot. An officer tumb out of the passenger side before the car is fully stopped He rolls on the pavement, then hurriedly rights himself a takes up a half-kneeling shooting stance. At the same time the little Cashier is emerging from the Eleven with his gun. The two bang away at Hi's retreating figure - the Policem revolver popping, the Cashier's Magnum booming. We hear the Policeman who is still in the car drawling ov its loudspeaker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt. It's a police warning, son.  Put those groceries down and turn  yourself in.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Legs pumping, panty hose still over his head, its unused streaming behind him like an aviator's scarf. The gun is  tucked into his belt; the Huggies are tucked securely und his arm. Behind him we can see the OFFICER and the Cashier squeeze off another couple shots, and then the policeman piles ba into the squad car.

dialogues.speaker: ED'S CAR
dialogues.text: Driving. She hears distant gunshots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch... Hold on,  Nathan. We're gonna go pick up Daddy. She hangs a vicious U-turn.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Huffing and puffing down the road with his Huggies. The cop car careens onto the street in the background, it siren wailing. The PASSENGER COP is leaning far out his window, one hand gripping the light-and-siren rack, the other pointing a g at Hi, shooting away. Bullets whizz past. Suddenly, with a soft pthunk! the Huggies box pops forwar out from under Hi's arm - hit by a bullet. Still running, reaches forward, tries to catch it on the fly, bobbles it tips it - loses it. He overruns it a couple steps before can bring himself up short. He turns and reaches to pick up the box but - PING-PING - bullets chew up the road near his hand. Leaving the Huggies, Hi takes off through a well-manicure yard. The police car is proceeding on down the street to catch around the corner, the driver still drawling over his  loudspeaker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's private property, son. Come  back out to the street and reveal  yourself to Officer Steensma and  Officer Scott - that's me.

dialogues.speaker: YARD
dialogues.text: Hi vaults a fence to land in the backyard. As he straightens to his feet we hear a horrible snarling and barking. A huge black Doberman is bounding across the lawn. It loo like it means to rip Hi's throat out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog's racing POV as it bounds toward the paralyzed Hi The dog leaps - camera flying up toward Hi's face - and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog's slavering muzzle flies into frame and - stops,  bare inches from Hi's nose, and the dog falls back, havin reached the end of his chain. Hi resumes running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the dog, snarling and straining against the end of his chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down along the chain toward the spike mooring it to the  ground. As the dog strains, the spike starts to stir in t ground. Other dogs can be heard barking now, the Doberman having  started a sympathetic wave.

dialogues.speaker: ED'S CAR
dialogues.text: Her jaw set, she takes a hard turn, looking this way and  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch... The police car approaches and roars by, the Passenger Cop still hanging out his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Lookie Nathan, a police car... She is looking in her rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Say, that looks like Bill Steensma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera is shooting forward at ground level, following the Doberman as it bounds along. The Doberman is dragging his chain and spike, which stretch into the foreground,  bumping and scraping along the road. Far ahead we can see Hi running, then turning down an  intersecting street. A second dog peels into the road to bound along with the  Doberman.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HI
dialogues.text: Running up a dark street. There is an oncoming pickup. Hi runs directly at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER screams and brakes - not quite in time. Hi rolls onto the hood, and off, and gamely trots over to open the passenger door. The Driver is leaning over to tell him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, you got a panty on your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drive fast... He is displaying his gun as he starts to climb in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and don't stop till I tell ya. Before Hi can get his door shut the Driver is obediently  peeling out. Hi is reacting to an oncoming car. He peels the stocking to look, and leans across the Driver's lap to bellow as E car passes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Honey! Hi turns to look through the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's car is braking and spinning into a U-turn.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HI
dialogues.text: Leaning out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind the baby now! Next to him, the Driver is screaming. As Hi turns forward, the entire windshield explodes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pimply-faced Cashier from the 7-Eleven is standing in the middle of the road ahead, sighting down his .44 Magnu for another shot. We are rushing in.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: Still screaming.

dialogues.speaker: THE CASHIER
dialogues.text: Ready to fire and - THUMP - he is bowled over by the arri Doberman, still trailing chain and spike, and now accompa by three other dogs, all braying at the top of their lung Still screaming, the Driver puts his body into a hard rig turn to avoid the Cashier and hellhounds.

dialogues.speaker: NEW STREET
dialogues.text: Roaring up the new street, they are now directly in the p of the oncoming police car, its siren wailing, barreling  straight at them. Still screaming, the Driver leans into another hard right Wind is whistling in through where the windshield used to be. Two wheels hop curb as the car skids into the new street, fishtails, and roars away.

dialogues.speaker: ED'S CAR
dialogues.text: She hears dogs, siren, squealing brakes on an adjacent st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Nathan, we'll take a shortcut. She gives the wheel a hard right turn. But there is no cross street. The car hops the curb and r up someone's nicely tended front yard, heading for the ga between this house and the one next door.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Recovered and turned around from its near collision with SCREAMING; Driver, the squad car is now squealing onto th street the Screamer swerved on to - resuming pursuit. As the police car roars down the street, Ed's car appears from between two houses behind it, bounces down the front yard to the street and follows the police.

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMER'S PICKUP
dialogues.text: Raking two-shot of Hi and the Screamer. Hi is looking bac over his shoulder at the pursuing police. Desperately pleading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I stop now? Hi looks forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are rushing toward an imposing colonial house plante at the end of the dead-end street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepped on hard. The brakes scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car squeals to a halt Hi is catapulted through whe the windshield used to be, tumbling over the hood onto th front lawn. He rolls to his feet and, as he runs up the lawn, calls b over his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: We are tracking behind Hi as he runs up to the house and  crashes through the screen door. Still tracking behind him as he runs through the living r A middle-aged couple sits on the couch watching TV. They  look up as Hi rushes by. Hi plunges down a staircase. As he does so we hear: ka-ch ka-chock ka-chick ka-chock. He emerges into a rec room where he and we rush past two  kids playing ping-pong. He runs out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: As he runs into the house. As he runs through the living room we catch a glimpse of middle-aged couple gaping at him. OFFICER STEENSMA plunges down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Outdoors now, running, crossing the street behind the hou and entering the parking lot of a supermarket on the othe side.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: As a pack of dogs thunders in. The lead Doberman with cha and spike has now picked up about a dozen neighborhood do The dogs thunder through the living room and down the sta As they hit the rec room the thunder of their feet turns  into the clatter of nails on tile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hi bursts in. Tracking on him as he runs down the broa front aisle, head whipping as he runs, looking up each  perpendicular lane, searching for something. He turns up one of the last lanes, races along it and gra a carton of Huggies, still on the flat run. He emerges into the broad back aisle and runs along it, b at the first perpendicular lane he hits, we see Officer  Steensma, gun leveled, at the other end. He fires. Hi keeps running. The Policeman is running along the front aisle, keeping p with Hi running along the back aisle. He squeezes off sho at Hi as each lane gives him the opportunity. Hi abruptly stops between lanes and doubles back, losing Policeman. He runs down the second lane he comes to towar the front of the store. The pack of dogs appears at the end of the lane and thund up toward Hi, braying at the top of their doggy lungs. Th lead Doberman holds in his teeth a paper 7-Eleven cap. Hi reverses again, and emerges into the back aisle. BANG! A pyramid of cranberry juice explodes at his should The Policeman has been waiting at the end of the back ais he aims once again. Hi plunges down the next lane but is brought up short as BOOM! five jars of applesauce explode in front of him. Hi looks. Standing in the raised platform-cubicle at the front of t store is the Store Manager, a fat man in a white short-sl shirt with a lit cigarette dangling from his mouth. The Manager cracks open his shotgun and inserts two more  cartridges - THOONK THOONK - in the smoking chamber. Hi doubles back once again toward the back aisle. He is still several paces from the end of the lane when t Policeman appears there, squaring to face him. The Policeman is in front of him. The MANAGER is blowing groceries on the shelves behind him.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: As he coolly levels his police special and takes aim at H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still on the dead run, Hi is flinging the carton of Huggi The carton rockets straight at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Futilely raising his gun to avoid-impact: The Huggies cat him square on the chest. The force makes him stumble one  fatal step backwards - into the back aisle - where: CRASH - He is hit broadside and bowled over by a rocketin shopping cart, propelled by an hysterically screaming SHO

dialogues.speaker: SHOPPER
dialogues.text: Racing on down the back aisle, bellowing.

dialogues.speaker: HER FEET
dialogues.text: Tracking from in front. Beyond her we can see the pack of furiously barking dogs, nipping at her heels. They boil o the prostrate Officer Steensma, and this is the last we s of him in this movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hi emerges through the back door. Ed is just skidding  around the corner. Hi scrambles in the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raking two-shot with Hi in the foreground. The car peels of the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you honey, you really didn't  have to do this- THWAK - Ed gives him a good hard slap and Hi's head rolls toward the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch! You're actin'  like a mad dog! Rubbing his jaw:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn left, honey. Still at top speed, she leans into a hard left, tires  squealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if me'n the baby'd been picked  up? Nathan Jr. would a been accessory  to armed robbery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nawww honey, it ain't armed robbery  if the gun ain't loaded-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of home life is this for a  toddler?! You're supposed to be an  example!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now honey, I never postured myself  as the three-piece suit type - Turn  left, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a child now, everything's  changed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Nathan Jr. accepts me for what  I am and I think you better had,  too. You know, honey, I'm okay you're  okay? That - there's what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but honey -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See I come from a long line of  frontiersmen and - here it is, turn  here dear - frontiersmen and outdoor  types. Hi's eyes are fixed on something in the road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna live this way, Hi. It  just ain't family life! Hi's attention is still on the road. He is opening his do even though the car is still racing along. He absently  concedes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... It ain't Ozzie and Harriet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the extreme foreground sits the first carton of Huggie that Hi dropped in the middle of the road. The car is  approaching. As the car passes the carton, Hi's hand reaches from the  passenger door and snags it.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: As Hi pulls the carton in and slams his door shut. Crane in the car speeding away.

dialogues.speaker: TRAILER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: As Ed bursts in the front door, holding Nathan Jr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: ON GALE AND EVELLE
dialogues.text: They look up, dumbstruck and mortified, from the sofa whe the have been watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning. Now I got nothing  against you personally... Gale and Evelle look appealingly toward Hi, who shifts  uncomfortably behind Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you're wanted by the  authorities and you're a bad influence  in this household, in my opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ma'am... we sure didn't mean to  influence anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we did, we apologize. Ed is unmoved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm goin' in to town tomorrow to see  about some shots for the baby. When  I come back you better be gone or  I'll kick you out myself. She storms into the bedroom and slams the door. There is an awkward silence as Gale studies his thumb and Evelle stares at the ceiling. Finally Evelle turns to Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What's he need, his dip-tet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm awful sorry boys, but when Ed  gets mad, you know, when she gets an  idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there ain't a thing to apologize  for, H.I... He looks at Evelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It seems pretty clear what the  situation is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess the Missus wants us to  clear out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now H.I., you'll pardon me for sayin'  so, but I get the feelin' that this- here... His gesture seems to take in the trailer and the entire  domestic situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...ain't exactly workin' out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now Ed's generally a real  sweetheart, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as per usual, I wouldn't be  surprised if the source of the marital  friction was financial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, matter of fact, I did lose my  job today-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Hi. you're young, you got  your health - what do you want with  a job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But look, I'd rather light a candle  than curse your darkness. As you  know, Evelle'n I never go anywhere  without a reason... and here we are  in your little domicile. We come to  invite you in on a score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank, Hi. Hi is shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw boys, I don't-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're partial to convenience  stores but, H.I., the sun don't rise  and set on the corner grocery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like Doc Schwartz says: You  gotta have a little ambition. Why we  just heard on the news how somebody  snatched off one of the Arizona  babies. Now there's someone thinkin'  big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here you are sittin' around on  your butt playin' house with a -  don't get me wrong, H.I., with a  fine woman - but a woman who needs  the button-down type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now that ain't really any of  your-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just lookahere... He is handing Hi a folded-up picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture of El Dorado, Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though the locals call it the Farmers  and Mechanics Bank of LaGrange. Looks  like a hayseed bank and, tell you  the truth, it is a hayseed bank.  Except the last Friday of every  financial quarter there's more cash  in that bank than flies at a barbecue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And guess what day it is tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya see, H.I., it's when the hayseeds  come in to cash their farm subsidy  checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-One information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it in the joint from a guy named  Lawrence Spivey, one of Dick Nixon's  undersecretaries of agriculture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in for solicitin' sex from a  state trooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordinarily we don't associate with  that class of person, but... Gale chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he was tryin' to make brownie  points with some of the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, I can't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need someone handy with a scatter- gun to cover the hayseeds while we  get the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'understand, H.I., if this works  out it's just the beginning of a  spree across the entire Southwest  proper. We keep goin' 'till we can  retire - or we get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way we're fixed for life. Hi is still shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, it's a kind offer, but you're  suggesting I just up'n leave Ed. Now  that'd be pretty damn cowardly,  wouldn't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it?  Think about it, H.I. Seems  to me, stayin' here, y'ain't doin'  her any good. And y'ain't bein' true  to your own nature. The camera has floated in to a close shot of Hi, staring  glumly at GALE.

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCYCLE NIGHT
dialogues.text: Following it, very close, we see only its rear wheel and  fender and twin exhaust pipes, one on either side. Flame boiling in each exhaust pipe as the hog roars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind the Biker's head as he rides through the nigh With the sharp whipcrack effect he suddenly looks left,  searching. With a second whipcrack effect he suddenly loo right, still searching. He banks into a turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creeping in. Late at night. We are tracking in toward the one window that is illuminated, with a feeble yellow ligh In voice-over, Hi is composing a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dearest Edwinna. Tonight as you  and Nathan slumber, my heart is filled  with anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creeping in on Hi 's hunched back, as he sits over the ki table writing the letter. The yellow lamp sitting on the  table is the only light on in the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I hope that you will both  understand, and forgive me for what  I have decided I must do. By the  time you read this, I will be gone.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Creeping in on GALE and EVELLE, sprawled on the sofa and  easy chair respectively, sawing boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I will never be the man that you  want me to be, the husband and father  that you and Nathan deserve...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HI
dialogues.text: Still creeping in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's my upbringing; maybe it's  just that my genes got screwed up -  I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creeping in on the pimply-faced Cashier, sitting asleep b the counter, a dirty magazine lying face-down, open on hi chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the events of the last day have  showed, amply, that I don't have the  strength of character to raise up a  family... We are slowly panning over to the newspaper rack, reveali tomorrow's headline: "WHERE IS NATHAN JR.?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in the manner befitting a  responsible adult, and not like the  wild man from Borneo.

dialogues.speaker: ARIZONA HOME
dialogues.text: Creeping in on Nathan Jr. in the living room, asleep in h ottoman armchair, lit only by the snow from the TV set he facing, a half-full glass of milk on the coffee table nex to him. His robe is disheveled; his eyeglasses have slid down his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I say all this to my shame.

dialogues.speaker: TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Creeping in on Ed and Nathan Jr., asleep together in the  double bed. Ed's arm is draped protectively over the slee infant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I will love you always, truly and  deeply. But I fear that if I stay I  would only bring bad trouble... We start to hear the rumble of the motorcycle mix up agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on the heads of you and Nathan  Jr.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: Night sky. The motorcycle tire enters frame as the bike c to a halt. The Biker plants a jackbooted foot in the  foreground. The engine rumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel the thunder gathering even  now; if I leave, hopefully, it will  leave with me. We are craning up over the Biker's back to reveal what he looking at: We are on a bluff overlooking the trailer par In the window of one trailer below, a yellow light glows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot tarry...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HI
dialogues.text: Still creeping in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better I should go, send you money,  and let you curse my name. Your  loving... Herbert.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: Roaring at the cut. Through it we can see the Biker sitti on the ground, legs stretched out in front of him, back  resting against his parked motorcycle, arms folded across his chest. Perfectly motionless, he stares at the campfire. We are floating in toward him. As we come closer, eventually drawing in to a close shot his face, we gradually realize something peculiar about h eyes: He seems to have none. Although his eyes are  unblinkingly open we do not see eyeballs, but only fire - either a reflection of the campfire or something roaring burning-inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reads: "Come On In! To Unpainted Arizona." The smoking butt of a cheroot is dropped onto the mat. A  jackbooted foot grinds it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leading into the showroom. The Biker's mail-and-chained f pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the jackboots as they stroll through a showroom of unpainted furniture and bathroom fixtures.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAILED HAND
dialogues.text: Swinging as he walks, the Biker's hand produces a fresh  cheroot from no apparent source-either sleight-of-hand or magic.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER HAND
dialogues.text: Similarly producing a long wooden match.

dialogues.speaker: DISCOLORED TEETH
dialogues.text: Biting down on the cigar.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: Dragging the kitchen match along the unfinished wood surf of an expensive bureau, leaving an ugly black scar. The match erupts into roaring flame.

dialogues.speaker: CIGAR
dialogues.text: Crackling as it is lit.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: Reading "Executive Offices." The mailed fist pushes it op

dialogues.speaker: PEBBLED GLASS DOOR
dialogues.text: From the inside of the office. The name on the pebbled gl is a backwards Nathan Arizona. There is the shadow of a man approaching the door, and mu voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Arizona, he just barged  in... The door swings open and Nathan stands looking in, his mi aged secretary hanging at his elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Should I call Dewayne? Nathan is staring toward his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no, why wake the security guard.  I'll take care a this. The secretary leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Biker sits with his back to us, jackboots propped laz on the desk. His head bobs and ducks, as if he is following some movem in the air in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NATHAN
dialogues.text: Eyes on the Biker he slams the door shut behind him, look for some reaction.

dialogues.speaker: BIKER
dialogues.text: No reaction. His head continues to bob and duck.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NATHAN
dialogues.text: Circling the Biker as he crosses to sit behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arcing around to reveal the Biker's face. He still does n react to Nathan, not even bothering to give him a glance. His eyes continue to follow some phantom movement. When the Biker speaks it is still without looking at Nath and with a surprisingly soft voice and mild, unhurried ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got flies. He finally looks at Nathan, and smiles faintly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it. This place's climate- controlled, all the windows are  sealed. Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name of Leonard Smalls. My friends  call me Lenny... He takes a drag on his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Only I ain't got no friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, you'll make me bust out crying.  Listen Leonard, you want some  furniture or a shitbox, they're out  on the sales floor. SMALLS is pleasantly shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo, I ain't a customer, I'm a  manhunter. Ordinarily. Though I do  hunt babies, on occasion. Hear you  got one you can't put your hand to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wal, that's my business. I'm a tracker- part Hopi Indian, some say part hound  dog. When some dink skips bail,  crashes outta the joint, I'm the man  they call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, I got the cops, the state  troopers and the Federal-B-I already  lookin' for my boy. Now if you got  information I strongly advise-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop won't find your boy. Cop couldn't  find his own butt if it had a bell  on it. Wanna find an outlaw, call an  outlaw. Wanna find a Dunkin Donuts,  call a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smalls, first off, take your damn  feet off m'furniture. Second off,  it's widely known I posted a twenty  grand reward for my boy. If you can  find him, claim it. Short of that  what do we got to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Price. Fair price. And that ain't  whatever you say it is; fair price  is what the market'll bear. Now there  are people, mind you, there are people  in this land, who'll pay a lot more'n  twenty grand for a healthy baby. Nathan is looking at him stonily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give you an idea, when I was a lad I  m'self fetched twenty-five thousand  on the black market. And them's 1954  dollars. I'm sayin, fair price. For  fifty grand I'll track him, find him- Quick as a flash the heretofore languid Smalls bolts forw his fist stopped an inch short of Nathan's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His index finger and thumb are pinched together-holding t leg of a struggling fly that he has just plucked from the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the people that took him... He flicks the fly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll kick their butts. He sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...No extra charge. Nathan stares grimly at Smalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I don't pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I'll get your boy regardless.  Cause if you don't pay, the market  will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know what I think? I think  you're an evil man. I think this is  nothin' but a goddamn screw job. I  think it's a shakedown. I think you're  the one took Nathan Jr. and my fine  friend, I think you're the one gonna  get his butt kicked... Nathan swivels to punch numbers on a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm on the phone to the cops  right now, and I- He swivels back, looking up, and his speech stops short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is empty. A whipcrack effect builds to the cut and:

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: His eyes snap open as the whipcrack echoes away. He has been slumped over the kitchen table, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and attem, H.I. Today is the first  day of the rest of your life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and already you're fuckin' it up. Hi looks up. Gale and Evelle are smiling down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, the missus'll be back from  town soon. Hi takes the envelope that he was slumped over, to Ed wri on its face. As he sticks it to the refrigerator door wit broccoli magnet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedroom, in his crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sawin' toothpicks, he'll be  fine. There is a harsh knock at the door. All three tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You expectin' anybody? Hi is staring. The knock comes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You two stay outta sight. He goes to the door, pulls back its shade and peeks out.  Under his breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Glen. He backs nervously down to the foot of the st as Hi stands in the half open doorway. Glen comes to rest few feet away from the stoop. He is wearing a neckbrace. The bridge of his eyeglasses i taped together. Cotton wadding is stuffed up his nose, wh is darkly discolored. He holds a rolled up newspaper. His station wagon is parked behind him, idling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning Glen. Glen speaks in a very nasal voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't comin' in if ya don't mind.  I'll just keep my distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't invite you in, Glen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't even bother. First off,  you're fired - and that's official.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda figured that, Glen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that ain't why I'm here neither.  No sir. You're in a whole shitload  of trouble, my friend. Hi is looking at him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just calm down, Glen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you make me?! Know that  little baby you got in there? Remember  him? I know what his real name is! Hi is suddenly nervous and urgent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna keep your voice down, Glen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pitch my voice wherever I please!  His name ain't Hi Jr.! His name ain't  Ed Jr.! But it's junior an right!  Yes sir, it's Nathan Jr.! Hi takes one step down holding out a calming hand. Glen takes two nervous steps away and reassures himself b resting a hand on the door of his station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Stay away from me, McDunnough! Hi stops short. Glen smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sure, you're an awful big man  when you got somethin' around to  clobber a guy with!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't a big man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right! And now you're at my  mercy! He spits on the dirt in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm your worst nightmare!  I wanted  to just turn you in for the re-ward.  But Dot, she wants something to  cuddle. So it looks like that baby's  gonna be Glen Jr. From now on! Hi's face is set in rigid dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll give you a day to break the  news to Ed... Glen is getting into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Dot'll be by tomorrow to pick him  up. He slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's either that or jail. Oh and  say, that reminds me! You'll find a  doctor bill in the mail in a few  days. I recommend you pay it! And the car squeals off. Hi looks back at the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slat in the window blind drops back into place.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HI
dialogues.text: He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelle is already emerging from the bedroom with the baby his arms. Hi moves toward Evelle. His teeth are set; he means busin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on here. Gale steps in front of Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what's goin' on, H.I. It's  just business. Now this can go either  hard or easy- Hi gives Gale a hard push to get past him. Gale staggers  back but recovers and grabs Hi in a bear hug. Hi flips Gale. Gale lands on a coffee table which flips u and crashes back down. Evelle is dancing back out of Hi's reach. As Hi lunges fo him the prostrate Gale grabs his legs. Hi goes down hard. Gale leaps to his feet and - CRASH - bangs his head up ag an overhanging lamp. Both of his hands fly up to massage top of his head. THOOMP - Hi's fist flies into frame to connect with Gale' unguarded stomach. Gale doubles over, clutching at his gu Hi interlaces his fingers to make a club of his two hands With Gale's bowed head a target in front of him, Hi swing his hands up over his head. Hi's knuckles scrape painfully against the plaster of the too - low ceiling. Skin is flayed, plaster crumbles. Hi grabs at his knuckles in pain. Gale lunges with a mid- body tackle that sends Hi crashing into the wall. Gale, still on top of him, reaches back to throw a punch. The reach-back sends his elbow crashing through a window doesn't stop the punch. It connects with Hi's jaw. Gale throws another quick punch, all his weight behind it Hi's head bobs sideways just in time and Gale's fist goes through the wall. It is momentarily stuck there. Hi uses the opportunity to grab Gale's one free arm with  both of his. He is twisting it to make Gale, roaring with pain, twist around and present his back to him. Hi climbs aboard, grabbing Gale's face. Gale, still roaring, is pulling his fist out of the hole. grabs a lath exposed by the hole and pulls; it tears out the wall and snaps free, giving him a length of about two feet. Gale is rampaging around like a grizzly bear hemmed in a small space. Hi is hanging on for dear life, his own feet flailing this way and that, knocking over lamps and wall  fixtures as Gale bends and twirls about, trying to shake loose. Gale crashes and bounces off the walls, roaring in pain and fury. Close shots of Gale's face show his features impossibly a grotesquely contorted by Hi's hand, squeezing, gripping a clutching at it. Evelle is dancing around with the baby, dodging crashing  furniture and flailing body parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the cut Gale's roaring drops out. We hear the chirping birds and the laughter of children playing in the  neighborhood. It is a sunny day.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO INT. TRAILER
dialogues.text: Gale still roars. With a last mighty effort, he finally s Hi off his body. Hi crashes against a wall and through it to land in the:

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Amid a shower of plaster dust and lath. Hi has landed,  groggily, against the toilet. Evelle enters now with his hands free, apparently having the baby down somewhere. He yanks the cord off the bathroom blinds.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Hi is seated in a straight-back chair, still violently  struggling but Gale's arms are wrapped around him from be Evelle is just finishing tying off his wrists behind the  chair. No one talks; there is nothing left to say. Finished, Gale goes to the door and Evelle goes to the  bedroom. He emerges with the baby and precedes Gale out t door, Gale slamming it behind him. Hi starts bucking and struggling, weeping tears of rage a frustration. He succeeds only in tipping forward, face do into the carpet, the strapped-on chair pressing down on t of him. His profile is pressed into the carpet. Offscreen we hear the door of the trailer opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At carpet level. Gale's shoes enter his field of vision.  They stride over to a mess of debris in the corner of the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gale paws through the wreckage to expose the copy of D Spock's Baby and Child Care. He grabs the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feet walk away and leave his field of vision.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: As we hear the door slam shut with horrible finality. Hi's mouth stretches wide. He ROARS with grief and  frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving down the road toward an oncoming car. As the oncom car gets closer we can see Gale and Evelle in its front s As the car passes we pan with it, to reveal that we have  been shooting from the inside of another car, and we hold the profile of its driver: Ed. She has just watched the o car shoot past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ed sits heavily into frame, apparently in shock, her f profile to the camera as she stares straight ahead into s Her foreground hand absently holds a length of cord. Beyond her in the middle background Hi is rummaging in th debris. He stands up, cropped from the chest down and sta loading bullets into the chamber of Ed's .38 police speci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're worried honey but  believe me, there ain't a thing to  worry about. We're gonna get him  back, there just ain't no question  about that... He snaps the chamber shut and leaves frame, still talking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We'll get him back, that's just  all there is to it. And you wanna  know another thing? He is walking back into frame holding another handgun now addition to the .38, this one an automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm gonna be a better person from  here on out. And that's final, I  mean that's absolutely the way it's  gonna be, that's official. You were  right and I was wrong... He snaps a clip into the automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A blind man could tell you that.  Now they ain't gonna hurt him, they're  just in it for the score... Hi is leaving frame again, continuing to talk as we hear rummaging offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But I ain't like that no more,  I'm a changed man. You were right  and I was wrong. We got a family  here and I'm gonna start acting  responsibly... Hi enters frame with the two handguns stuck in his belt,  holding his pump-action shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So let's go honey... He primes the shotgun: WHOOSH-CLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Let's go get Nathan Jr.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: From the front bumper of an automobile. Beautiful desert  stretches to the horizon. The road rushes under the camer

dialogues.speaker: GALE AND EVELLE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Gale drives, gazing out at the road. Evelle holds Nathan  Jr., occasionally bouncing him. Contemplatively:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I luuuuv to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said somethin' there, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yessir, I figure with the ransom  and this bank, you'n I'll be sittin'  in the fabled catbird seat. Evelle is looking down at the baby, shifting him in his l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Gale... Junior had a, uh,  accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, pardner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a little accident. Gale looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddya mean, he looks okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ya see... Movin' though we are,  he just had hisself a rest stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's perfectly natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Gale!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? Evelle, beaming, looks up from the baby to Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He smiled at me!

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN
dialogues.text: A huge rumbling rippling red ball that fills the frame. As we hear his footfalls on concrete steps, Smalls rises  into frame, apparently climbing a stoop. The sun behind h throws him into silhouette; the extreme telephoto flatten him against the sun. Heat waves ripple between us and him making his figure slightly waver. The rumble builds, louder and louder, until it is snapped off by a-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. The front door handle clicks open and Smalls stand in the doorway. The abandoned trailer is perfectly quiet. The room is a complete shambles from the fight. Sunlight  filters in between the slats of the venetian blinds. Smok from Lenny Smalls' cheroot ripples up through the light. After only a momentary pause at the door to take in the s Smalls goes directly to a specific spot in the debris and nudges some of it aside with his toe, exposing a piece of paper. He bends down to pick it up but suddenly freezes, with a  soft grunt of surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At knee-height on the wall in front of him, "FART" is scr in crayon.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SMALLS
dialogues.text: As he stands up with the piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: THE PAPER
dialogues.text: It is Gale's picture of the Farmers and Mechanics Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a carton of diapers being set down on the check- counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know how you put these thangs on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelle and the Cashier, a late-middle-aged man (perhaps t proprietor of this small mom-and-pop store) face each oth across the check-out counter. Evelle has various baby  purchases - the diapers, baby food, etc. - piled on the  counter. The Cashier is ringing them up. Through the open door beyond them we can see a strip of t parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welp. Around the butt, then up over  the groin area-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where they go, old timer. I  mean do I need pins or fasteners? We see Gale trotting past through the visible part of the parking lot, cooing "Weeeeee!" as he holds Nathan Jr. Up  over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well no, they got those tape-ettes  already on there, it's self-contained  and fairly explanatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... He takes a plastic-covered squirt gun off a display rack drops it on the counter. He is looking around at the othe impulse purchases displayed by the register; he unhooks a bag of balloons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...These blow up into funny shapes  at all? Gale is trotting by in the opposite direction: "Weeeeee!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well no. Unless round is funny. Evelle is pulling a gun out of his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll take these too. Now  you lie down back there-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't you move till you've counted  up to eight hundred and twenty-five  and then backwards down to zero.  I'll be back to check - see y'ain't  cheatin'. The Cashier is already down on the floor, out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the diaper burglar? As he heads for the door with the groceries:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like I'm one of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Evelle hurriedly emerges with the two bags. Faintly we can hear the Cashier bellowing: "One one thousand, two on thousand..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the door, will ya? Gale is slipping the baby back into his car seat, which s on the roof of the car. He starts doing up the straps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a real cheerful little critter  once he warms up to ya. Hands free now, Gale reaches for the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up Gale... Gale has the door open. Evelle starts throwing in the  groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how high this one can  count.

dialogues.speaker: GALE AND EVELLE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Gale drives as Evelle sorts through his purchases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him some baby grub... baby  wipes... diapers, disposable... packet  of balloons-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They blow up into funny shapes at  all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just- Gale is looking around, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, where's Junior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddya mean, didn't you put him in?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I thought- The two men look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: The two men's heads whip around to look in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd we leave him?! The two men's eyes widen as they remember at the same tim both look up at the roof of the car.

dialogues.speaker: GALE'S FOOT
dialogues.text: Coming off the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: EVELLE
dialogues.text: Screaming as he watches the foot:

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOOO
dialogues.text: But too late.

dialogues.speaker: GALE'S FOOT
dialogues.text: Already plunging down on the brake. SQUEEEEEEEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelle is screaming at the top of his lungs as the car ro to a stop. He peers through the windshield, still screami but nothing has shot off the roof of the car. He cranes his neck to look up the slant of the windshield toward the roof. This of course gives him no view; still  screaming, he thrusts his body out his open window to loo up at the roof. His scream is muted as his head disappear from view, then comes back full force as he ducks back in frantically shaking his head. With this Gale's last hope disappears and he starts bello also.

dialogues.speaker: GALE'S FOOT
dialogues.text: Rising from the brake to plunge down on the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it hangs a squealing U-turn and races off at top speed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foreground Nathan Jr. sits upright in his car seat in the middle of the road that fronts the convenience sto He is placidly looking at the scenery. Faintly, we hear the Cashier bellowing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Seven hunnert ninety-seven one  thousand, seven hunnert ninety-six  one thousand...

dialogues.speaker: GALE AND EVELLE
dialogues.text: In their speeding car, both staring out at the road ahead mouths gaping, emitting ear-splitting screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot faces the front of the store with some of the street visible outside. The Cashier on the floor is out of frame but we can hear him loud and clear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Seven hunnert ninety-one one  thousand, seven hunnert - ah...  bullshit. He rises into frame, back to the camera, just as: We see  Gale and Evelle's car, through the front window, roaring the street. Quick as a shot, the Cashier has dropped back out of frame and resumes bellowing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven hunnert ninety - ought one  thousand! Seven hundred eighty - The car is starting to squeal to a screaming halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Nathan Jr. in the foreground. Gale and Evelle's car  comes to a rocking halt behind - and inches shy of - the  baby. Evelle's door is already open. He bolts from it and runs  over to the baby, blubbering. He picks up the car seat an Nathan Jr. Gale is also getting out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise we ain't never gonna give  him up, Gale! We ain't never gonna  let him go! Gale, choked up, speaks in a low unsteady voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never give him up, Evelle.  He's our little Gale Jr. now.

dialogues.speaker: HI AND ED'S CAR
dialogues.text: Hi driving. Both are staring wordlessly ahead at the road Hi looks over at Ed, glum but trying to be kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ed, I realize I can't be much of  a comfort to you. But lemme just say  this... He is nodding to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll feel a whole lot better when-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about myself anymore. I  don't care about us anymore. I just  want Nathan Junior back safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't get him back safe, I  don't wanna go on livin'. And even  if we do, I don't wanna go on livin'  with you. This shuts Hi up. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I guess I still love you Hi; I  know I do. I ain't even blaming you.  The whole thing was crazy and the  whole thing was my idea. Hi clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, factually, I myself bear a  very large-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme finish. Since those jailbirds  took little Nathan I been doin' some  thinking, and I ain't too proud of  myself. Even if Mrs. Arizona had  more'n she could handle, I was a  police officer sworn to uphold the  Constitution of the United States -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now waitaminute honey, you resigned  before we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't the point, Hi. We don't  deserve Nathan Jr. Any more'n those  jailbirds do. And if I'm as selfish  and irresponsible as you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'ain't that bad, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm as bad as you, what good're  we to each other. You'n me's just a  fool's paradise.

dialogues.speaker: FARMERS AND MECHANICS BANK
dialogues.text: Baking in the noonday sun.

dialogues.speaker: GALE AND EVELLE
dialogues.text: Sitting in the front seat of their idling car, looking at the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Welp... They look at each other. Gale reaches for his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Let's do her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waitaminute. What do we do with Gale  Jr.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wuddya mean, he waits here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!  He can't wait here  by hisself. Supposin' we get killed  in there - it could be hours before  he's discovered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gale and Evelle bang in through the door. Evelle holds shotgun; Gale holds a shotgun in one hand and Nathan Jr. his car seat in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right you hayseeds, it's a stick- up! Everbody freeze! Everbody down  on the ground! Everyone freezes, staring at Gale and Evelle. An Old Hays with his hands in the air speaks up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well which is it young fella? You  want I should freeze or get down on  the ground? Mean to say, iffen I  freeze, I can't rightly drop. And  iffen I drop, I'm a gonna be in  motion. Ya see -

dialogues.speaker: SHUTUP
dialogues.text: Promptly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everone down on the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all can just forget that part about  freezin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is until they get down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all hear that? There is a murmur of acknowledgment from all the people o the ground. Gale is tossing Evelle a sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna fill that sack, pardner? We  got - shit! He is looking in shock at the tellers' counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Where'd all the tellers go? There is no one behind the counter. A muffled voice from offscreen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're down here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're down on the ground like you  commanded, Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to use m'damn name!  Can't you even try to keep from  forget'n that?! Evelle is momentarily abashed, but then brightens:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even yer code name? Gale registers understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... m'code name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all hear that? There is a murmur of acknowledgment from all the people o the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right now everone, we're just  about ready to begin the robbery  proper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera is locked down on the roof of the rocketing sq car, looking past its flashing gumballs. The car is approaching the townlet, its siren wailing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE BANK
dialogues.text: A teller is finishing stuffing the last of two burlap bag Close on her hands, we see her putting in a cash packet t is really only a few bills and a sleeve surrounding and h a small plastic device. The teller hits a button on the device and it starts tick she shoves it into the sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right now everyone, you know how  this works: Y'all stay flattened for  ten full minutes... He is grabbing the two sacks and tosses one to Gale, who  also picks up the baby. As the two are backing toward the door:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We might come back in five to  check. That's for us to know and y'a  to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone found bipedal in five wears  his ass for a hat. They bolt out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siren jumps in loud at the cut. It is the same locked-dow shot over the gumballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeling out from in front of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale is driving; Evelle starts pawing through one of the  sacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That old timer threw off my  concentration. Otherwise it would a  gone smoother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We done okay. Yessir. This ought to  split nicely three ways. A thought registers with Gale and Evelle at the same mome They look at each other. They both twist frantically to l in the back seat. Bellowing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit! Ya never leave a man  behind! KA-POP! With a loud flat crack something detonates in the front seat and the interior of the car is spattered with  bright blue paint. Gale and Evelle, both covered in blue, are screaming in r fear and incomprehension. Blue dollar bills snap and flut around the inside of the car. The car is swerving wildly as Gale drives blind, the insi of the windshield covered with blue paint. He reaches for to wipe clear a patch of windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the blue paint is smeared away we see Hi and Ed's car  parked broadside in the middle of the road. Hi and Ed are front of it, Hi aiming his scatter gun, Ed a revolver. The guns spit orange flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the barrel of his shotgun. The car with the blue int is swerving crazily at us, one front tire blown out. Hi lets go with the other barrel. The shot chews up the front grill, shatters one headlight and blows out the other front tire. The hood of the car f open. The car is squealing to a halt and Gale and Evelle pile o still bellowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit H.I., ain't we got enough  to contend with? Ed is running over to Gale and Evelle's car, throwing ope the back door to look for the baby but coming out only wi Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Evelle is staggering around in shock, looking in disbelie at his own blue body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the baby? Evelle points this way and that, in a state of confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we left him on the roof of  the... he must be back at the... Hi and Ed are climbing into their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us come with you! Hi and Ed are already peeling out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He's our baby too! CLOSE ON NATHAN JR. Sitting placidly in his car seat that sits in the middle the road in front of the bank. We can hear the wail of the police siren still approachin As we hold on Nathan Jr. we hear the distant booming of a shotgun. As we boom up to show the empty street beyond the baby, w hear the crack of return fire and furiously squealing bra The screech culminates in a loud explosion that snaps off the siren wail. The police car is apparently history. From beyond the crest of the road ahead a ball of flame h leapt up with the explosion. As the explosion echoes and  fades we hear the deep rumble of an approaching engine. Lenny Smalls' motorcycle appears over the rise. Framed ag fire and smoke, he is coming directly toward us, and the  baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they top a rise coming from the other direction. We se the baby sitting in the middle of the street, and Lenny f approaching from the background.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKED DOWN TO MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: The extremely low wide shot, locked down to the speeding  bike, shows us rushing toward the rear of Nathan Jr's car seat. With a clank of chains Lenny's hand drops down into frame palm forward, tensing to scoop up the car seat that we ar almost upon. A tattoo on Lenny's wrist reads "No Prisoners."

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Low shot with Nathan Jr. in the foreground. He is scooped up and out of frame as Lenny roars by.

dialogues.speaker: ON LENNY
dialogues.text: Roaring along. He hooks the car seat over his handlebars.

dialogues.speaker: OVER HI AND ED'S SHOULDERS
dialogues.text: Lenny is approaching. Under her breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...D'you see him too? Lenny is sawing a shotgun out of his back holster and lev it at the oncoming car. Lenny is sighting down the gun, swinging it around as he  approaches the car.

dialogues.speaker: HI AND ED DUCK JUST AS
dialogues.text: The shotgun spits orange flame and the windshield explode in. Lenny roars by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby on the handlebars in the foreground; the road ru by beyond him. The bike banks into a hard turn.

dialogues.speaker: FACING HI AND ED
dialogues.text: Shooting through where the windshield used to be, cutting at the end of the skid as the car rocks to a halt. Hi and Ed are raising their heads. Facing forward, they d not see Lenny approaching again through the rear window. He is sawing out his second shotgun. Hi looks around, reaches and pulls Ed down beneath him ju as: KA-BOOM! - The second shotgun roars and the back window s in. As Lenny roars past the back window he casually flips  something in.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN AT HI AND ED
dialogues.text: Folded over in the front seat. Below them something bounc into and around the leg well - Lenny's grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the two front doors fly open and Hi and Ed spill out - from the driver's side, heading for the far side of the r and Ed from the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: ON ED
dialogues.text: As she dives for cover behind a parked car. Beyond her -  KABOOM! - their car explodes and bounces, pouring black s

dialogues.speaker: ON HI
dialogues.text: The explosion flings him to the ground in the middle of t street.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH FIRE AND SMOKE
dialogues.text: Looking up the street to where Lenny is wheeling his bike a U-turn. He is not finished yet. Hi flat on his back, woozily shaking his head. He weakly raises himself on his elbows to look down the  street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down the length of his own body. His legs stretch away in a V. Crashing down from a wheelie, Lenny's roaring bike is alm upon him - aiming up the middle of the V.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: He rolls. As the bike is roaring by:

dialogues.speaker: HI'S HAND
dialogues.text: Reaches and snags a chain on Lenny's passing boot.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Dragged several yards before the boot shakes him off, lea him on his stomach in the middle of the road. Hi looks up the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny is again sluing the bike around.

dialogues.speaker: REAR WHEEL OF BIKE
dialogues.text: Smoking as it skids around in the foreground, completing turn. Boom up Lenny's back to reveal Ed stomping straight up th street toward him - unarmed, unafraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that baby!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HI
dialogues.text: He reaches back to pull up his shirt, revealing a gun tuc in his pants in the small of his back. He grabs the gun.

dialogues.speaker: OVER LENNY'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As Ed closes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that baby, you warthog from  hell! Lenny's arms rise into frame. With a roll of his wrists t knives appear in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HI
dialogues.text: On his stomach, sighting down the gun toward Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed stepping into his line of fire, blocking Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raising an arm to stab. Ed stoops to scoop the baby from the car seat, revealing: Hi, behind her. He fires.

dialogues.speaker: LENNYS HAND
dialogues.text: Drilled by Hi's bullet, drops its knife. The exit wound spurts, not flesh and blood, but a brief j of fire.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Quick as a flash hurling the other knife at Hi.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: As the knife stings the gun out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KNIFE ON THE GROUND AT LENNY'S FEET
dialogues.text: Lenny bends to scoop up the knife he dropped.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND ED
dialogues.text: As she runs toward the bank, clutching Nathan Jr. to her  chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ed bursts in. The floor is littered with obedient hays From where he lies prone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just lie down on the floor, missie. BANG: The front door bursts open before Lenny's roaring h It sails off a step into the sunken atrium, and lands wit CRASH amidst the hayseeds.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND ED
dialogues.text: As she runs for the back door and pushes through it.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND LENNY
dialogues.text: As he slaloms through the wildly scattering hayseeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lenny bursts out. With a whipcrack effect he looks left, then right. He jer the bike right, to where an alleyway flanks the side of t bank.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEYWAY
dialogues.text: Ed is running up the alley toward the front of the bank a Lenny enters. He roars after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roaring down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF ED
dialogues.text: As the bike approaches behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing on Ed as she reaches the mouth of the alley. A pl swings into frame, straight at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Matching action as Hi finishes swinging the plank into Le face. Lenny hits the ground hard as his bike spins out from und him.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIKE
dialogues.text: Riderless, twisting crazily into the street where it  collapses.

dialogues.speaker: HI AND ED
dialogues.text: Lenny is rising to his feet beyond them as Hi nods  encouragement to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run along now, honey. Lenny is reaching back to throw his knife. Hi, unaware, is turning to face him, presenting the plank the knife is thrown. It thunks into the plank, piercing it through. Hi backs up, swinging the knife - studded plank to make L keep his distance.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND LENNY'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As he reaches up to unhook a chain from a ring on his ves shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY'S HAND
dialogues.text: As the free chain drops down into his palm.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Swinging the chain - WHOOSH WHOOSH - at the backpedaling

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANK
dialogues.text: As the chain snakes around it and rips it out of Hi's han

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Grabbing Hi by the shirtfront.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY'S OTHER HAND
dialogues.text: Swings down and brass knuckles appear on it.

dialogues.speaker: ON HI
dialogues.text: As Lenny's fist swings into frame to club him forehand, t backhand. An uppercut from his heels sends Hi sprawling back.

dialogues.speaker: A PARKED CAR
dialogues.text: As Hi lands against it, banging his head. He sinks to the ground. Lenny is casually walking toward him, lighting a cheroot. flops over onto his stomach and starts wriggling under th car.

dialogues.speaker: FROM UNDER THE CAR
dialogues.text: Hi's face in the foreground as he desperately seeks escap Behind him we can see Lenny casually reaching down and  grabbing an ankle. The shot is framed identically to the shot in the Arizona nursery where Hi pulled a baby from under the crib. Lenny pulls. Hi is dragged away from the camera and out f under the car.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Struggling to stand up. Lenny wraps his arms around him and applies a tremendous  bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: HI'S ARMS
dialogues.text: Crushed against Lenny. His hands paw futilely at Lenny's  chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny finally flings Hi away.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Landing in the dust, all the fight beaten out of him.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Tired of the fight: He saws out both shotguns

dialogues.speaker: THE HAMMERS
dialogues.text: On the guns as Lenny's thumbs draw them back. He raises t guns to fire.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: The end of the road. He wearily lifts a hand, defensively extending it in fron of him - then stops, staring at:

dialogues.speaker: HI'S HAND
dialogues.text: A hand grenade pin hangs, glinting, from one of his finge Pawing at Lenny's chest he must have hooked his finger th its ring.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Reacting.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Reacting to Hi reacting. He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY'S CHEST
dialogues.text: On the bandoliers across his chest, silver pins glint in the grenades - except one. Its squeeze-lever juts at a ri angle from the grenade.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY'S FACE
dialogues.text: Hi's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY'S FEET
dialogues.text: The lit cheroot hits the ground between his boots.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Scrambling to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Trying to drop the shotguns to free his hands. In his pan his fingers tangle in the trigger guards.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Starting to run.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Finally freeing his hands.

dialogues.speaker: HI
dialogues.text: Diving behind the parked car.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY'S CHEST
dialogues.text: His hands fly in to wrap around the grenade - too late -  bright light:

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Blows sky-high. There is a roar as if the earth were crac open and flame as if hell were slipping out. We pan the fire to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white aluminum ladder rises up into the blackness, clan softly. The top of the ladder arcs toward the camera.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP BACK
