dialogues.text: To the interior of the Arizona second-story nursery as th ladder comes to rest against the window frame. It is late at night; the nursery is dark and empty.

dialogues.speaker: THE HEADBOARD
dialogues.text: Of the unpainted crib with the burned-in names: Harry, Ba Larry, Garry, and Nathan Jr. As we pull back from the headboard Ed's arms are gently  depositing the sleeping Nathan Jr. into the crib. Hi puts the singed copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care next t the baby.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Hi and Ed looking sadly down at the baby. The silence is broken by the bleat of a squeeze-me toy as the lights are snapped on. Hi and Ed turn, startled.

dialogues.speaker: NURSERY DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Nathan stands in his jammies, hair disheveled, holding a and squinting against the light. Keeping the gun trained on Hi and Ed, he slowly raises a  pair of eyeglasses to his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell is goin' on? He advances cautiously into the nursery, gesturing with h gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Get away from there. Hi and Ed back away from the crib. Nathan peers in and studies the baby for a moment. He lays the gun down, tenderly picks up the baby and hold him to his chest. A tear forms at the corner of his eye. Hi and Ed are quietly moving back towards the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waitaminute... Hi and Ed Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I ain't through with you. What're  you doin' creepin' around here in  the dark? You in with Smalls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Scuse me? As he bounces the baby, studying Hi and Ed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard Smalls, big fella rides a  Harley, dresses like a rock star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir, that's who we saved him from.  It's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you tell it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, in a re-ward situation,  they usually say no questions asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they. Hi shrugs. Nathan turns to put the baby back in the crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...All right, boy, I guess you got a  re-ward coming. Twenty thousand  dollars... He turns around with a thought:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or, if you need home furnishings,  I can give you a fine of credit at  any of my stores. Fact, that's the  way I'd rather handle it, for tax  reasons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well- Nathan throws his hands up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you the truth, I think we'd  prefer the ca-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want no reward. Hi does a small take, surprised at this much integrity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We didn't bring him back for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we could work it that way too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I just look at him a little  bit more? She stands looking into the crib. Hi steps up next to her and puts an arm around her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guest, young lady... but would  you mind tellin' me exactly how you- Ed starts crying softly as she gazes into the crib. Hi mu something to comfort her. Nathan is studying the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You took him, didn't you? Wasn't  that biker a'tal. Hi turns to face him. He speaks in a rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took him, sir, my wife had nothin'  to do with it. I crept in yon window  and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both did it. We didn't wanna hurt  him any; I just wanted to be a mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't for money or nothin'. We  just figured you had more'n you could  handle, babywise. But I'm the one  committed the actual crime sir, if  you need to call the authorities-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutup boy, no one's callin' the  authorities if there's no harm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw bullshit. Just tell me - just  tell me why you did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't have our own. Nathan looks at her. Finally he nods and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well lookit. If you can't have  kids you gotta just keep tryin' and  hope medical science catches up with  you. Like Florence'n me - it caught  up with a vengeance. And hell, even  if it never does, you still got each  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, those're kind words. But I think  the wife and me are splittin' up... He indicates Ed with a nod of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Her point of view is we're both  kinda selfish and unrealistic, so we  ain't too good for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ma'am, I don't know much but I  do know human bein's. You brought  back my boy so you must have your  good points too. I'd sure hate to  think of Florence leavin' me - I do  love her so... He clears his throat and turns to the door. His tone is h again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You can go out the way you came  in... He snaps off the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And before you go off and do  another foolish thing, like busting  up, I suggest you sleep on it... He has disappeared into the hall. We hear his voice reced

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...at least one night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking straight down at Hi, asleep in the trailer bedroo We start to crane down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night I had a dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful dusk landscape. We are floating in over the f abutting the prison, that Gale and Evelle popped out of. In the middle background of the extreme long shot two men are walking across the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I dreamt I was as light as the  ether, a floating spirit visiting  things to come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craning down toward Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shades and shadows of the people  in my life wrastled their way into  my slumber.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO FIELD
dialogues.text: Still floating forward but now much closer to the two wal men. We see that they are Gale and Evelle. Both are still dyed blue. They are approaching the hole in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dreamt that Gale and Evelle had  decided to return to prison... Evelle is starting to climb into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Probably that's just as well. I  don't mean to sound superior, and  they're a swell couple guys, but... Evelle has disappeared and Gale starts climbing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...maybe they weren't ready yet to  come out into the world.

dialogues.speaker: FLOATING UP THE WALK OF THE ARIZONA HONE
dialogues.text: The front door has a holly wreath on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I dreamed on, into the  future, to a Christmas morn in the  Arizona home...

dialogues.speaker: ARIZONA LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Five three-year-olds in their pajamas are opening present around a tree as Nathan and Florence look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where Nathan Jr. was opening a  present from a kindly couple who  preferred to remain unknown. We have been isolating in on one of the children peeling wrappings off a package marked to Nathan Jr. Inside is a  shiny red plastic football.

dialogues.speaker: FLOATING IN TOWARD A STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: Pulled over on the state highway in the middle of the des a police motorcycle parked behind it. Glen is leaning out the driver's window of the car talking to the state troop who stands facing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Glen, a few years later, still  havin' no luck gettin' the cops to  listen to his wild tales about me'n  Ed... Glen is grinning and talking with his hands cupped in fro of him, as when he told Hi about the Pollack who almost  stepped in the pile of shit. The trooper, in crash helmet and dark sunglasses, is list tight-lipped and stone-faced as Glen finishes his story a slaps his knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Maybe he threw in one Pollack  joke too many... The trooper is clicking open his ballpoint pen and reachi his citation book from his breast pocket. The name tag on the pocket says "SGT. KOWALSKI."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: FLOATING IN TOWARD A FOOTBALL
dialogues.text: It sits on a tee in the middle of a football field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And still I dreamed on... A cleated foot boots the football out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...further into the future than I'd  ever dreamed before.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: Looking up, arms out at his sides, waiting to receive the kicked ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Watching Nathan Jr.'s progress  from afar... He catches the ball and starts running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Taking pride in his accomplishments  as if he were our own... He is skillfully eluding and stiff-arming tacklers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Wondering if he ever thought of  us. He reaches the end zone and triumphantly spikes the footb He whips off his helmet and we track in on the face of th rosy-cheeked high-school bruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and hoping that maybe we'd  broadened his horizons a little,  even if he couldn't remember just  how they'd got broadened.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Still craning down, now very close to the sleeping Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But still I hadn't dreamt nothin'  about me'n Ed. Until the end...

dialogues.speaker: A COUPLE
dialogues.text: The man and woman are sitting on a sofa in the foreground with their backs to the camera. They are in the living ro of Hi and Ed's trailer, which is suffused with a warm gol light. As they face the trailer's front door, all we see of the  couple is the backs of their heads. They both have white  hair, the woman's pulled into a bun. The old man wears a  cardigan, the woman a shawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And this was cloudier 'cause it  was years, years away. The front door bursts open. Two young couples are enterin as their kids - about a dozen of them - stream in around  them. The old couple on the couch raise their arms to embrace t visitors. The children boil onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But I saw an old couple bein'  visited by their children - and all  their grandchildren too. And the old  couple wasn't screwed up, and neither  were their kids or their grandkids.  And I don't know, you tell me. This  whole dream, was it wishful thinking?   Was I just fleein' reality, like I  know I'm liable to do?

dialogues.speaker: FLOATING IN TOWARD A LONG DINING TABLE
dialogues.text: In the trailer. The table is all laid out with a Thanksgi dinner, a huge turkey sitting at the far end. Cut-out letters at the other end of the room say: "WELCOM

dialogues.speaker: HOME KIDS
dialogues.text: The grandchildren are running into frame and taking their seats at the table, accompanied by their parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But me'n Ed, we can be good too... The elderly couple enter from either side of the camera a stand in the foreground, backs to us, facing the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And it seemed real. It seemed  like us. And it seemed like well...  our home... If not Arizona, then a  land, not too far away, where all  parents are strong and wise and  capable, and all children are happy  and beloved... I dunno, maybe it was  Utah. The elderly man drapes an arm around his wife's shoulder draws her close. She rests her head against his shoulder, and we:
